column5:
Reportable Communicable Diseases
 Monthly Report - December 2023

column2:
Source: Ontario Ministry of Health, integrated Public Health Information System (iPHIS), extracted [02/12/2024].
             Ontario Ministry of Health, Case and Contact Management System (CCM), extracted [02/13/2024].
1 Rate per 100,000 population. Population source:Statistics Canada, Centre for Demography, customized data (2019).
2 3-year average based on 2020-2022 data, rounded to the nearest integer.
3 This category captures cases with positive HBV markers with insufficient evidence to be classified; these are most likely carriers.

4 Due to operational constraints related to the COVID-19 Response, Hepatitis C reports (from February 2020 onwards) and Encephalitis/Meningitis reports (from January 2021 onwards) were not entered into the provincial reporting system (iPHIS).
5 The counts beginning in July 2023 may be undercounted and not directly comparable to previous months as cases are no longer linked to outbreaks.
6 Mpox was designated a Disease of Public Health Significance (DOPHS) on June 16, 2022.
7 TB cases included in this report are classified by diagnosis date.
8 Anaplasmosis, Babesiosis, and Powassan virus were designated as Diseases of Public Health Significance (DOPHS) on July 1, 2023.
9 Number of outbreaks and not number of cases counted.
